Do you need the things from chrome.css to help me troubleshoot? I can't keep using Safe Mode, don't care for Chrome, and refuse to use IE.

title: Need to explain the software to be downloaded
content:
This is a reoccurring theme.

Weboligarchs making false assumption the end user can read weboligarch’s minds.

This link states to download “Container” with a vague description. https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/74.0/whatsnew/all/?oldversion=73.0.1

vague descriptions is what selfish jerks do.

I need the Weboligarchs to provide the useful information before I and many others will download. How does this file work? What exactly does the file do? Provide screenshots of the interface? File size?

Why do Weboligarchs in general from all websites think the consumer should trust them and download software without providing detailed information what the software actually does?

Before 74.0 when I wanted to login LastPass would show with a 2 on it because I have a password for the main Firefox account and another for Support. So what I need is an easy way to duplicate a tab as a different window, so I can have two or more open at once.

Any thoughts/help are much appreciated.

title: Firefox geolocation returns wrong coordinates
content:
I want to build a progressive web app. This app requires the user's GPS coordinates. In order to test this functionality cross-browser, I use w3schooll geolocation implementation. Link: https://www.w3schools.com/html/tryit.asp?filename=tryhtml5_geolocation

Compared to Chrome, Firefox sometimes returns the wrong coordinates. For example yesterday (13/03/2020) the coordinates were wrong all day. Today (14/03/2020) the coordinates are right. The coordinates are crucial for the success of the app. I use Firefox 74.0

I'm sure the information there is well-meaning, but it will never be useful in diagnosing a specific problem if you obfuscate the details of the error from the user with bland, generic error pages and/or messages.

title: facebook container
content:
Hello good people, This is rather a request for advice than an issue report. I' ve learned about the facebook container add-on and wanted to know if there is a need for it if someone was making sure to exclusively open facebook.com in its own profile. Say you set up a profile(from about:profiles) namely "BIg Brothers" for notorious trackers like google, facebook , twitter etc so they can perpetually track each other with simple rules to observe like : - Never open an external(shared) link - Never access any other website through that profile.

Is there a particular feature the add-on is bringing up that the native interface is missing ? The other reason is add-ons are great but they tend to bloat the system impeding the browsing experience. I am the kind of guy who opens 7 concurrent tabs each running heavy js code so the lighter the better.

Thank you in advance,

Dom
creator: domignon

title: why do firefox group their officially-recommended-addons into different categories for what they do on their Recommended-Addons listing?
content:
Hi, I notice that mozilla/firefox don't seem to show types of addons into groups, especially their officially-recommended-addons https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/search/?recommended=true&type=extension - into different categories, as to what each add-on does, i.e. which productivity activities they might fall under for what they do. what good is 4 or more pages of add-ons in a list? I would want them in groups that fall under categories as a Type/dropdown. For example add that is great for taking notes, another for tracking protection, another for music, etc, etc. The listing page is simply a four page list with no divisions.

Could there be an additional Filter on the left side of the page that drops down showing all the different types of OFFICIALLY RECOMMENDED-addons depending on their function/purpose, please. not just by their names? I hope I can get my point across well enough, being a visual type, I might be unable to place it into the correct framework in a written way. My apologies in that case. Thank you and best regards!
creator: nmainferme

title: Keyboard shortcuts do not work anymore
content:
Keyboard shortcuts stopped working yesterday. Copy/paste still works, and tab, but for example ctrl-f (find), ctrl-b (open the bookmarks sidebar), alt-arrow for next/previous, ctrl-w (close tab), etc no longer do anything. Any ideas why that might happen?

This is not the only thing that broke yesterday (e.g. context menu text no longer appears except for icons and some plug-in items) but I don't know whether that is related.
creator: jh.dale
